title: The fundamental scale is the chromatic 12 tone scale! | Maths and music | N J Wildberger

media:group.media:title: The fundamental scale is the chromatic 12 tone scale! | Maths and music | N J Wildberger
media:group.media:description:
What is the most natural scale? Can we transcend our cultural indoctrinations when it comes to music and try to see the mathematical essence of things? And can we also move beyond the familiar musical thought patterns that the architecture of the piano (and to a lesser extent that of the guitar) imposes on us? 

If we start with an even tempered approach, then the 12 tone chromatic scale naturally emerges as the basic building block. We'll see how this gives rise to a new and more rational naming system for notes. This will have major implications for a deeper study of scales, modes and chords, attempting to move beyond our particular cultural orientations. 

This is one of a series of videos on the intimate relations between mathematics and music, where I am attempting to look at the foundations of music from a more mathematical point of view. And also we will see this gives us some surprising new insights into the nature of arithmetic!

I also want to introduce you to my very modest TikTok channel: 

www.tiktok.com/@njwildberger

where I am posting some on-the-spot piano improvisations, and the occasional classical piece, some of them not by J. S. Bach.
***********************
Screenshot PDFs for my videos are available at the website http://wildegg.com. These give you a concise overview of the contents of the lectures for various Playlists: great for review, study and summary.

My research papers can be found at my Research Gate page, at https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Norman_Wildberger

My blog is at http://njwildberger.com/, where I will discuss lots of foundational issues, along with other things.

Online courses will be developed at openlearning.com. The first one, already underway is Algebraic Calculus One at https://www.openlearning.com/courses/algebraic-calculus-one/ Please join us for an exciting new approach to one of mathematics' most important subjects!

If you would like to support these new initiatives for mathematics education and research, please consider becoming a Patron of this Channel at https://www.patreon.com/njwildberger Your support would be much appreciated! :)
